text: Light malty, caramel, quite weak aroma.amber, clear, light sweetness, then medium bitterness, medium body, bitter coffee, oily feel, maybe light caramel, bittersweet end
Pet láhev. Krásná barva amberu, rychlý nástup hořkosti a poté perfektní chuť. Skvělé polotmavé pivo.

#1135Tap. Hazy deep amber body, high off-white head. Aroma of caramel, pickles, yeast. Taste is semi-dry, lightly bitter. Caramel, roasted malts, toffee. Light to medium body, high carbonation. Empty.
Draught at BeerGeek Bar. Cloudy, amber colored. AROMA- insipid, toasted malts. FLAVOR- slightly sweet, toasted malts. Medium bodied. Not very good.
Keg at Beergeek. With Rachel, Amy & Janice. Pours Amber with an off White head. Sweet malty flavour with a light bitterness. Not very much going on. Easy drinking...
Tap at beergeek. Hazy amber colour with stable head off. Aroma of malts,caramel. Taste of caramel,malts. Light fruity,berries, bitter finish. Moderate carbonation

Bottle 1500ml. PET. [ As Hendrych H13 ].Clear medium amber orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, bread, grass - dusty grass - straw, light leather - rotten egg. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, dry, grass - dusty grass - straw, pale malt, bread. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160422]
Bottle @ Århus tasting. Pours deep amber with a off white head. Aroma of Brett, light rotten eggs, caramel, light marzipan notes, light toffee. Taste is rather sweet, marzipan and Brett.
Plastic bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are plastic, malt, caramel, fruits and hops.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and light hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 220416

1 L plastic bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Light malty and hoppy and sour aroma. Moderate bitter nice brett notes. Average light bitter finish. oily palate. Brett not intensionel but nice.

Bottle thanks to Nikos. Polotmave number seven. Pours clear Amber orange, medium creamy beige head, good lacing. Aroma is quite malty, caramel, nutty, dark bread, hint of smoke. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, malty, roasty, interesting. Medium light body.

(draught) opalescent amber-ruby colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of toffee, butterscotch and earth, with a light touch of straw and caramel. flavour is mostly caramel and bran flakes, with a light hint of butterscotch, some herbal hops and a light-bitter finish. light- to medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Lukt: Rosin og karamell.
Utseende: Gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Rosin og karamell.

On tap at "na 7.schode", Zilina. Clear dark amber with medium beige head, leaves lacing. Aroma of malts, caramel, bisuits, light grassy. Taste is medium sweet followed by zesty bitterness, caramel like aftertaste. Medium body, soft carbonation, thick texture.
Tap at Salón Piva. Light diacetyl aroma, taste is balanced, medium swwe and medium bitterness. drinkble

(Draught at Nota Bene, Prague, 23 July 2015) Amber colour with dense, beige head. Malty nose with notes of slightly roasted malt, toast, crisp-bread and some orange peel. Malty taste with rye bread, orange peel, toast, toffee and a balanced spicy bitterness. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Well balanced and tasty. Quite nice.
Bottle. Clear amber colour. Stable white head. Aroma diacetyl, strong. Taste is strongly affected by diacetyl. Raw grainy quality, toasted, burnt sugar. Also rough bitterness. Needs improvements.
Bottle kindly shared by fajry,many tthanks. Amber color with medium white head. Caramel malt in aroma with diacetyl. Taste, caramel, diacetyl, harsh bitterness in finish.
Fľaa. Jantárová farba, biela pena dlho drala. Vôňa sladká, karamelová, praené slady. Chuť na začiatku na mňa dosť sladká, neskôr je to vyváené karamelovou a praenou dochuťou.

Tap 0.4 l, W?odkowica 21, Wroc?aw, Poland.
Miedziane piwo z puszyst?, ?adnie oblepiaj?c? szk?o pian? i s?odowym zapachem. W smaku troch? wodniste, s?odowe, lekko karmelowe z ?agodn? goryczk? na finiszu.
Bottle at work shared by Simon, thanks. Pours amber color, white head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, roasted, malty, hints of chocolate.

Draught at Pivni Mapa, Prague. Clear golden/amber beer with a nice ladting offwhite/beige head. Dark bread aroma, caramel, roasted notes, chocolate notes, some fruits. Bready flavor, grassy, hay, citrus, dark bread, earthy notes, some chocolate. A bit different, but rather good.

Tap at Krkonosska hospudka , Prague , CZ , Malt,bread,roasted,caramel and fruity aroma , Hazy brown amber color with bigger lacing head , Sweeter taste with decent bitter finish , Fuller body , Average carbon , Pleasant polotmavy thats not too sweet.
On tap at Nota Bene, Prague. Pours hazy dark golden/amber with a big creamy white head. Aroma is malty, caramel and bread. Taste is moderate sweet malty , caramel, easy to like this one.

on tap at festival minipivovaru 2014 at prague castle. dark amber with a creamy head; aroma of rusted iron and red berry; surprisingly bitter and unsweet for a polotmavy; light burnt caramel; good stuff

Draught
Aroma-bread, grass, basement aromas, 
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-lightly bitter, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, flat, bitter finish
Overall- good
Draught @ Nota Bene, Prague. Pours amber with a creamy white head. Caramel, bread and fruit. Medium bodied. Chewy malty with a really bitter finish. Dope stuff. Clean and classy.

Draught @ Note Bene, Prague. Pours amber with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, wood, fresh grassy hops. Flavor is malty, caramel, wood, flowers, grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry light bitter finish. 180414
Clear dark amber body with low white head. Aroma has nutty notes, caramely. Taste has caramel sweetness, medium eartyhy bitterness. Body is full, high carbonation.

Not bad yes drinkable and full bodied nice colour and aroma of czech lands on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
On tap at Hotel Styl. Pours mostly clear brown with creamy tan head. Aroma is caramel, malt, yeast. Flavor is caramel, malt, yeast, hops.
Ruby colour, one finger beige head. Aroma of caramel, pears, apples. Taste is medium bitter. Light to medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Very drinkable.

Tapped. Aroma is not very interesting - some light sweet solod and malts, but the appearance is decent - solid dark-amber color with a very good and stable white head. The body tastes a bit sweet with a slight bitterness, which is continued in the very long and hoppy finish which I like. Not the very average polotmavy, I would say, but is interesting.

(tap 0,5l @ U Slovanské Lípy (Prague))
Very light sweet aroma. Clear amber-red color. Medium white head. Ligth sweet, light caramel taste. Dry finish. Quite good, but maybe in bad shape in U Slovanské Lípy.

ivory white head that disappears fast with some lacing. amber clear colour. aroma of malts, nuts. taste like aroma, yeast, bit sweet with the aftertaste bitter and alcoholic. medium body and carbonation.  draft @ Nota Bene (Praha)
Tap @ Nota Bene. Hazy brownish amber, creamy beige head. Full-bodied, malty with hints of caramel and roasted malts, very roasty. Pleasantly bitter hoppy finish.
